page.title: 08HEALTH
page.content: At the end of the 19th century the wife of the local laird-Lord Forester provided money for a cottage hospital named after her. It remains a General Practitioner hospital,providing accident/emergency service for minor injuries & a facility for minor surgery. Twice weekly x-rays can be taken & blood samples taken daily are sent by road to the Shrewsbury hospital. Regular clinics provide pre & post natal services with deliveries at Shrewsbury. Consultants from Wolverhamton attend 1 afternoon each week. Physiotherapy & chiropody are available. Two G.P.'s serve the area & in 1985 moved into a purpose built medical centre. Patients are seen by prior appointment or by calling and waiting. Much Wenlock has an optician but the nearest dentist is some miles away.
